00021 #include <iostream>
00022 #include <cmath>
00023 using namespace std;
00024 
00025 #include <starter.h>
00026 #include "keypoint_orientation_corrector.h"
00027 
00028 const short ACTUAL_MAX_GRADIENT = 1024;
00029 const unsigned short GRADIENT_SHIFT = 2;
00030 const short MAX_GRADIENT = ACTUAL_MAX_GRADIENT >> GRADIENT_SHIFT;
00031 
00032 #define ATAN2_TABLE_INDEX(dx, dy) (((dy + MAX_GRADIENT) * (2 * MAX_GRADIENT + 1)) + (dx + MAX_GRADIENT))
00033 
00034 const short MINIMAL_NORM = 0; // of the gradient to be taken into account
00035 
00036 #define DERIVATIVES_KERNEL_SIZE 1
00037 
00038 bool keypoint_orientation_corrector::subpixel_rotate = false;
00039 
00040 keypoint_orientation_corrector::keypoint_orientation_corrector(int _width, int _height, int _neighborhood_size, int _nbLev)
00041 {
00042   width = _width;
00043   height = _height;
00044   neighborhood_size = _neighborhood_size;
00045   nbLev = _nbLev;
00046 
00047   actual_neighborhood_size = neighborhood_size;
00048 
00049   angle_buckets = new int[ANGLE_BUCKET_NUMBER];
00050 
00051   initialize_tables();
00052 }
00053 
00054 void keypoint_orientation_corrector::initialize_tables(void)
00055 {
00056   atan2_table = new short[(2 * MAX_GRADIENT + 1) * (2 * MAX_GRADIENT + 1)];
00057 
00058   for(int dy = -MAX_GRADIENT; dy <= +MAX_GRADIENT; dy++)
00059     for(int dx = -MAX_GRADIENT; dx <= +MAX_GRADIENT; dx++)
00060     {
00061       int index = ATAN2_TABLE_INDEX(dx, dy);
00062       float norm2 = float(dx * dx + dy * dy);
00063       if (norm2 > MINIMAL_NORM * MINIMAL_NORM)
00064       {
00065         float angle = atan2((float)dy, (float)dx);
00066         angle = (float) ((angle + 3.14159) * 180 / 3.14159);
00067         if (angle < 0) angle = 0;
00068         if (angle > 359) angle = 359;
00069         int result = int(angle / ANGLE_QUANTUM + 0.5);
00070         if (result < 0) result = 0;
00071         if (result >= ANGLE_BUCKET_NUMBER) result = ANGLE_BUCKET_NUMBER - 1;
00072         atan2_table[index] = (short)result;
00073       }
00074       else
00075         atan2_table[index] = -1; 
00076     }
00077 
00078     orientation_lookup_tables = new int* [ANGLE_BUCKET_NUMBER*nbLev];
00079 
00080     // this image is used only to know widthStep for each level. TODO: cleanme.
00081     PyrImage im(cvCreateImage(cvSize(width, height), IPL_DEPTH_8U, 1), nbLev);
00082 
00083     for(int i = 0; i < ANGLE_BUCKET_NUMBER*nbLev; i++)
00084     {
00085       int level = i / ANGLE_BUCKET_NUMBER;
00086       int angle = i % ANGLE_BUCKET_NUMBER;
00087       int size = neighborhood_size /*>> (level)*/;
00088       int * table = orientation_lookup_tables[i] = new int[size * size];
00089       float cs = float(cos(angle * 2 * 3.14159 / ANGLE_BUCKET_NUMBER));
00090       float sn = float(sin(angle * 2 * 3.14159 / ANGLE_BUCKET_NUMBER));
00091       float c = size / 2.f;
00092       for(int y = 0; y < size; y++)
00093         for(int x = 0; x < size; x++)
00094         {
00095           float dx = x - c;
00096           float dy = y - c;
00097 
00098           int nx = int(cs * dx - sn * dy + 0.5);
00099           int ny = int(sn * dx + cs * dy + 0.5);
00100           table[y * size + x] = int(ny * im[level]->widthStep + nx);
00101         }
00102     }
00103 
00104     exp_weights = cvCreateImage(cvSize(neighborhood_size, neighborhood_size), IPL_DEPTH_32S, 1);
00105 
00106     // should test ACTUAL_NEIGHBORHOOD_SIZE here (ie where the first non nul weight appears)
00107     bool actual_neighborhood_size_found = false;
00108     for(int y = 0; y < neighborhood_size; y++)
00109     {
00110       int * W = (int *)(exp_weights->imageData + y * exp_weights->widthStep);
00111 
00112       for(int x = 0; x < neighborhood_size; x++)
00113       {
00114         float d2 = float(gf_sqr(x - neighborhood_size / 2) + gf_sqr(y - neighborhood_size / 2));
00115         float sigma_d2 = 5;
00116 
00117         W[x] = int(100 * exp(-d2 / (2 * sigma_d2 * sigma_d2)));
00118 
00119         if (y == neighborhood_size / 2)
00120           if (x > neighborhood_size / 2 && !actual_neighborhood_size_found)
00121             if (W[x] == 0)
00122             {
00123               actual_neighborhood_size = 2 * (x - (neighborhood_size / 2));
00124               actual_neighborhood_size_found = true;
00125             }
00126       }
00127     }
00128 }
00129 
00130 keypoint_orientation_corrector::~keypoint_orientation_corrector()
00131 {
00132   delete[] angle_buckets;
00133 
00134   for(int i = 0; i < ANGLE_BUCKET_NUMBER*nbLev; i++)
00135     delete[] orientation_lookup_tables[i];
00136   delete[] orientation_lookup_tables;
00137   if (atan2_table) delete[] atan2_table;
00138 }
00139 
00140 void keypoint_orientation_corrector::compute_gradient_images(IplImage * image, IplImage ** _Ix, IplImage ** _Iy)
00141 {
00142   *_Ix = cvCreateImage(cvSize(image->width, image->height), IPL_DEPTH_16S, 1);
00143   *_Iy = cvCreateImage(cvSize(image->width, image->height), IPL_DEPTH_16S, 1);
00144 
00145   cvSobel(image, *_Ix, 1, 0, DERIVATIVES_KERNEL_SIZE);
00146   cvSobel(image, *_Iy, 0, 1, DERIVATIVES_KERNEL_SIZE);
00147 }
00148 
00149 int keypoint_orientation_corrector::orientation_bucket_index(const IplImage * _Ix, const IplImage * _Iy,
00150                                                              const int u, const int v)
00151 {
00152   const int D = actual_neighborhood_size / 2;
00153 
00154   for(int i = 0; i < ANGLE_BUCKET_NUMBER; i++)
00155     angle_buckets[i] = 0;
00156 
00157   for(int y = -D; y < D; y++)
00158   {
00159     int dIx = (v + y) * _Ix->widthStep + (u << 1);
00160     short * Ix_row = (short*)(_Ix->imageData + dIx);
00161     short * Iy_row = (short*)(_Iy->imageData + dIx);
00162     int * W        = (int*)  (exp_weights->imageData + (D + y) * exp_weights->widthStep) + D;
00163 
00164     for(int x = -D; x < D; x++)
00165     {
00166       if (W[x] == 0) continue;
00167 
00168       int dx = Ix_row[x] >> GRADIENT_SHIFT;
00169       int dy = Iy_row[x] >> GRADIENT_SHIFT;
00170       int norm2 = dx * dx + dy * dy;
00171 
00172       if (dx <= -MAX_GRADIENT)      dx = -MAX_GRADIENT + 1;
00173       else if (dx >= MAX_GRADIENT)  dx =  MAX_GRADIENT - 1;
00174       if (dy <= -MAX_GRADIENT)      dy = -MAX_GRADIENT + 1;
00175       else if (dy >= MAX_GRADIENT)  dy =  MAX_GRADIENT - 1;
00176 
00177       int index = atan2_table[ATAN2_TABLE_INDEX(dx, dy)];
00178       assert(index <ANGLE_BUCKET_NUMBER);
00179       angle_buckets[index] += W[x] * norm2;
00180     }
00181   }
00182 
00183   // Here Lowe smoothes the angle_buckets histogram for a more robust estimation of the orientation
00184   // He also fits a parabola to refine the orientation. Not required in our method thanks to the classifier.
00185 
00186   int orientation_bucket_index = 0, value = angle_buckets[0];
00187   for(int i = 1; i < ANGLE_BUCKET_NUMBER; i++)
00188     if (angle_buckets[i] > value)
00189     {
00190       value = angle_buckets[i];
00191       orientation_bucket_index = i;
00192     }
00193 
00194     return orientation_bucket_index;
00195 }
00196 
00197 int keypoint_orientation_corrector::optimized_orientation_bucket_index(const IplImage * _Ix, const IplImage * _Iy,
00198                                                                        const int u, const int v)
00199 {
00200   const int D = actual_neighborhood_size / 2;
00201 
00202   for(int i = 0; i < ANGLE_BUCKET_NUMBER; i++)
00203     angle_buckets[i] = 0;
00204 
00205   for(int y = -D; y < D; y++)
00206   {
00207     int dIx = (v + y) * _Ix->widthStep + (u << 1);
00208     short * Ix_row = (short*)(_Ix->imageData + dIx);
00209     short * Iy_row = (short*)(_Iy->imageData + dIx);
00210     int * W        = (int*)  (exp_weights->imageData + (D + y) * exp_weights->widthStep) + D;
00211 
00212     int dx = (y + D) & 1;
00213 
00214     for(int x = dx; x < D; x+=2)
00215     {
00216       if (W[x] == 0) break;
00217 
00218       int dx = Ix_row[x] >> GRADIENT_SHIFT;
00219       int dy = Iy_row[x] >> GRADIENT_SHIFT;
00220       int norm2 = dx * dx + dy * dy;
00221 
00222       if (dx <= -MAX_GRADIENT)      dx = -MAX_GRADIENT + 1;
00223       else if (dx >= MAX_GRADIENT)  dx =  MAX_GRADIENT - 1;
00224       if (dy <= -MAX_GRADIENT)      dy = -MAX_GRADIENT + 1;
00225       else if (dy >= MAX_GRADIENT)  dy =  MAX_GRADIENT - 1;
00226 
00227       short index = atan2_table[ATAN2_TABLE_INDEX(dx, dy)];
00228       angle_buckets[index] += W[x] * norm2;
00229     }
00230 
00231     for(int x = -2 + dx; x >= -D; x-=2)
00232     {
00233       if (W[x] == 0) break;
00234 
00235       int dx = Ix_row[x] >> GRADIENT_SHIFT;
00236       int dy = Iy_row[x] >> GRADIENT_SHIFT;
00237       int norm2 = dx * dx + dy * dy;
00238 
00239       if (dx <= -MAX_GRADIENT)     dx = -MAX_GRADIENT + 1;
00240       else if (dx >= MAX_GRADIENT) dx =  MAX_GRADIENT - 1;
00241       if (dy <= -MAX_GRADIENT)     dy = -MAX_GRADIENT + 1;
00242       else if (dy >= MAX_GRADIENT) dy =  MAX_GRADIENT - 1;
00243 
00244       short index = atan2_table[ATAN2_TABLE_INDEX(dx, dy)];
00245       angle_buckets[index] += W[x] * norm2;
00246     }
00247   }
00248 
00249   // Here Lowe smoothes the angle_buckets histogram for a more robust estimation of the orientation
00250   // He also fits a parabola to refine the orientation. Not required in our method thanks to the classifier.
00251 
00252   int orientation_bucket_index = 0, value = angle_buckets[0];
00253   for(int i = 1; i < ANGLE_BUCKET_NUMBER; i++)
00254     if (angle_buckets[i] > value)
00255     {
00256       value = angle_buckets[i];
00257       orientation_bucket_index = i;
00258     }
00259 
00260     return orientation_bucket_index;
00261 }
00262 
00263 void keypoint_orientation_corrector::rotate_patchf(IplImage * original_image, float u, float v, 
00264                                                    IplImage * rotated_patch,
00265                                                    float angle)
00266 {
00267   static float m[6];
00268   static CvMat M = cvMat( 2, 3, CV_32F, m );
00269 
00270   m[0] = (float)(cos(-angle));
00271   m[1] = (float)(sin(-angle));
00272   m[2] = u;
00273   m[3] = -m[1];
00274   m[4] = m[0];
00275   m[5] = v;
00276 
00277   cvGetQuadrangleSubPix(original_image, rotated_patch, &M);
00278 }
00279 
00280 void keypoint_orientation_corrector::rotate_patch(IplImage * original_image, int u, int v, 
00281                                                   IplImage * rotated_patch,
00282                                                   int orientation_bucket_index, int level)
00283 {
00284   if (original_image->depth == IPL_DEPTH_8U && rotated_patch->depth == IPL_DEPTH_8U)
00285   {
00286     int * table = orientation_lookup_tables[level * ANGLE_BUCKET_NUMBER + orientation_bucket_index];
00287     char * src = original_image->imageData;
00288     int offset = (int)v * original_image->widthStep + (int)u;
00289     unsigned max = (unsigned)original_image->widthStep*(original_image->height+1);
00290     char * dst = rotated_patch->imageData;
00291 
00292     const int length = neighborhood_size * neighborhood_size;
00293     for(int i = 0; i < length; i++) {
00294       unsigned idx = offset + table[i];
00295       if (idx < max)
00296         dst[i] = src[idx];
00297     }
00298   }
00299   else if (original_image->depth == (int)IPL_DEPTH_16S && rotated_patch->depth == (int)IPL_DEPTH_16S)
00300   {
00301     int * table = orientation_lookup_tables[level* ANGLE_BUCKET_NUMBER + orientation_bucket_index];
00302     short * src = (short*)(original_image->imageData + (int)v * original_image->widthStep) + (int)u;
00303     short * dst = (short*)(rotated_patch->imageData);
00304 
00305     const int length = neighborhood_size * neighborhood_size;
00306     for(int i = 0; i < length; i++)
00307       dst[i] = src[table[i]];
00308   }
00309   else
00310   {
00311     cerr << "keypoint_orientation_corrector::rotate_patch invalid depths" << endl;
00312     cerr << "depth 1 = " << original_image->depth << endl;
00313     cerr << "depth 2 = " << rotated_patch->depth << endl;
00314   }
00315 }
00316 
00317 float keypoint_orientation_corrector::estimate_orientation_in_radians(IplImage * image, int u, int v, 
00318                                                                       IplImage * _Ix, IplImage * _Iy)
00319 {
00320   // Avoid a warning:
00321   image = 0;
00322 
00323   int _orientation_bucket_index = orientation_bucket_index(_Ix, _Iy, u, v);
00324 
00325   return _orientation_bucket_index * 2 * 3.14159f / ANGLE_BUCKET_NUMBER;
00326 }
00327 
00328 int keypoint_orientation_corrector::correct_orientation(IplImage * image, int u, int v, 
00329                                                         IplImage * rotated_neighborhood,
00330                                                         IplImage * _Ix, IplImage * _Iy, int level)
00331 {
00332   int _orientation_bucket_index = orientation_bucket_index(_Ix, _Iy, u, v);
00333 
00334   rotate_patch(image, u, v, rotated_neighborhood, _orientation_bucket_index, level);
00335 
00336   return _orientation_bucket_index;
00337 }
00338 
00339 int keypoint_orientation_corrector::correct_orientationf(IplImage * image, float u, float v, 
00340                                                          IplImage * rotated_neighborhood, 
00341                                                          float orientation_in_radians, int level)
00342 {
00343   if (subpixel_rotate)
00344     rotate_patchf(image, u, v, rotated_neighborhood, orientation_in_radians);
00345   else {
00346     int _orientation_bucket_index = int(orientation_in_radians * ANGLE_BUCKET_NUMBER / (2 * 3.14159));
00347     if (_orientation_bucket_index < 0) _orientation_bucket_index = 0;
00348     if (_orientation_bucket_index >= ANGLE_BUCKET_NUMBER) _orientation_bucket_index = ANGLE_BUCKET_NUMBER - 1;
00349     rotate_patch(image, (int)(u+.5f), (int)(v+.5f),  rotated_neighborhood, _orientation_bucket_index, level);
00350   }
00351 
00352   return 0;
00353 }
